characteristics: Based on a specific founder or ancestor.
Strong religious or philosophical color (Taoism, Buddhism).
Emphasis on history and succession of specific martial arts.
Formed by individuals with shared interests or goals.
Less bound by ancient tradition or religion compared to Munpa.
Organizational structure is prioritized over lineage.
Bangpa (방파 / Faction or Gang).note: While distinct in definition, the terms are often used interchangeably in casual context.

naming_suffixes.description: The last character of an organization's name determines its type and scale.

list.nuance: Religious or regional martial arts group. Usually located on a mountain.
Interest-based group, often lower class or street-level, but can be massive.
Family-based or a specific school of thought. Often implies a bloodline or strict master-disciple bond.
Grand, mysterious, isolated, or extremely powerful. Often implies royalty or divine status.
list.example: Bukhae Bing-gung (North Sea Ice Palace / 북해빙궁), Podallap-gung (포달랍궁)

list.nuance: Military-style base or a heavily fortified family residence.
Wealthy private residence, merchant guild base, or a neutral territory.
Alliance, merchant guild, or a gathering for a specific purpose.
